==Events==
*[[1462]] &ndash; [[Vlad III the Impaler]] attempts to [[assassination|assassinate]] [[Mehmed II]] ([[The Night Attack]]) forcing him to retreat from [[Wallachia]].
*[[1497]] &ndash; [[Cornish Rebellion of 1497#Battle of Deptford Bridge|Battle of Deptford Bridge]] &ndash; forces under King [[Henry VII of England|Henry VII]] defeat troops led by [[Michael An Gof]].
*[[1565]] &ndash; [[Matsunaga Hisahide]] assassinates the 13th [[Ashikaga shogunate|Ashikaga shogun]], [[Ashikaga Yoshiteru]].
*[[1579]] &ndash; [[Francis Drake|Sir Francis Drake]] claims a land he calls ''[[New Albion|Nova Albion]]'' (modern [[California]]) for [[England]].
*[[1596]] &ndash; The Dutch explorer [[Willem Barentsz]] discovers the Arctic archipelago of [[Svalbard|Spitsbergen]]. 
*[[1631]] &ndash; [[Mumtaz Mahal]] dies during [[childbirth]]. Her husband, [[Mughal emperor]] [[Shah Jahan]] I, will spend the next 17 years building her [[mausoleum]], the [[Taj Mahal]].
*[[1673]] &ndash; [[French people|French]] explorers [[Jacques Marquette]] and [[Louis Jolliet]] reach the [[Mississippi River]] and become the first Europeans to make a detailed account of its course.
*[[1773]] &ndash; [[Cúcuta]], [[Colombia]], is discovered by [[Juana Rangel de Cuéllar]].
*[[1775]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: Colonists inflict heavy casualties on British forces while losing the [[Battle of Bunker Hill]].
*[[1789]] &ndash; In [[France]], the [[Estates of the realm|Third Estate]] declares itself the [[National Assembly (French Revolution)|National Assembly]].
*[[1839]] &ndash; In the [[Kingdom of Hawaii]], [[Kamehameha III]] issues the [[edict of toleration]] which gives [[Roman Catholic Church|Roman Catholics]] the freedom to worship in the [[Hawaiian Islands]]. The [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Honolulu|Hawaii Catholic Church]] and the [[Cathedral of Our Lady of Peace]] are established as a result.
*[[1843]] &ndash; The [[Wairau Affray]], the first serious clash of arms between [[Māori people|Māori]] and British settlers in the [[New Zealand Wars]], takes place.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Vienna, Virginia]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; American Civil War: [[Battle of Aldie]] in the [[Gettysburg Campaign]].
*[[1876]] &ndash; [[American Indian Wars]]: [[Battle of the Rosebud]] &ndash; 1,500 [[Sioux]] and [[Cheyenne]] led by [[Crazy Horse]] beat back [[General officer|General]] [[George Crook]]'s forces at Rosebud Creek in [[Montana Territory]].
*[[1877]] &ndash; American Indian Wars: [[Battle of White Bird Canyon]] &ndash; the [[Nez Perce people|Nez Perce]] defeat the [[Cavalry (United States)|U.S. Cavalry]] at White Bird Canyon in the [[Idaho Territory]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; The [[Statue of Liberty]] arrives in [[New York City|New York Harbor]].
*[[1898]] &ndash; The [[Hospital Corpsman|United States Navy Hospital Corps]] is established.
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Boxer Rebellion]]: [[Eight-Nation Alliance|Allied Western and Japanese]] forces [[Battle of Dagu Forts (1900)|capture]] the [[Taku Forts]] in [[Tianjin]], China.
*[[1901]] &ndash; The [[College Board]] introduces its first standardized test, the forerunner to the [[SAT]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; [[Aurel Vlaicu]] pilots an [[A. Vlaicu nr. 1]] on its first flight.
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Herbert Hoover]] signs the [[Smoot-Hawley Tariff Act]] into law.
*[[1932]] &ndash; [[Bonus Army]]: Around a thousand [[World War I]] veterans amass at the [[United States Capitol]] as the [[United States Senate|U.S. Senate]] considers a bill that would give them certain benefits.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Kansas City Massacre|Union Station Massacre]]: In [[Kansas City, Missouri]], four [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] agents and captured fugitive [[Frank Nash]] are gunned down by gangsters attempting to free Nash.
*[[1939]] &ndash; Last public guillotining in France: [[Eugen Weidmann]], a convicted murderer, is guillotined in [[Versailles, Yvelines|Versailles]] outside the Saint-Pierre prison.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: {{RMS|Lancastria}} is attacked and sunk by the [[Luftwaffe]] near [[Saint-Nazaire]], France. At least 3,000 are killed in Britain's worst maritime disaster.
*  1940   &ndash; World War II: The [[British Army]]'s [[11th Hussars]] assault and take [[Fort Capuzzo]] in [[Libya]], [[Africa]] from [[Kingdom of Italy (1861–1946)|Italian]] forces.
*  1940   &ndash; The three [[Baltic state]]s of [[Estonia]], [[Latvia]] and [[Lithuania]] fall under the [[Occupation and annexation of the Baltic states by the Soviet Union (1940)|occupation]] of the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Iceland]] declares [[Icelandic National Day|independence]] from [[Denmark]] and becomes a [[republic]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Uprising of 1953 in East Germany|East Germany Workers Uprising]]: In [[East Germany]], the Soviet Union orders a division of troops into [[East Berlin]] to quell a [[rebellion]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[Ironworkers Memorial Second Narrows Crossing]], in the process of being built to connect [[Vancouver]] and [[North Vancouver (district municipality)|North Vancouver]] ([[Canada]]), collapses into the [[Burrard Inlet]] killing many of the ironworkers and injuring others.
*[[1960]] &ndash; The [[Nez Perce people|Nez Perce]] tribe is awarded $4&nbsp;million for {{convert|7|e6acre|km2}} of land undervalued at 4 cents/acre in the 1863 treaty.
*[[1963]] &ndash; The [[United States Supreme Court]] rules 8–1 in ''[[Abington School District v. Schempp]]'' against requiring the reciting of [[Bible]] verses and the [[Lord's Prayer]] in [[public school (government funded)|public schools]].
*  1963   &ndash; A day after [[Leaders of South Vietnam|South Vietnamese President]] [[Ngo Dinh Diem]] announced the [[Joint Communique]] to end the [[Buddhist crisis]], a riot involving around 2,000 people breaks out. One person is killed.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[People's Republic of China]] announces a successful test of its first [[thermonuclear weapon]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; President [[Richard Nixon]] declares the U.S. [[War on Drugs]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Watergate scandal]]: Five [[White House]] operatives are arrested for burgling the offices of the [[Democratic National Committee]], in an attempt by some members of the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican party]] to illegally [[Telephone tapping|wiretap]] the opposition.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[STS-51-G]] [[Space Shuttle Discovery]] launches carrying [[Sultan bin Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud]], the first [[Arab]] and first [[Muslim]] in space, as a [[Payload Specialist]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; With the death of the last individual of the species, the [[Dusky Seaside Sparrow]] becomes extinct.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Apartheid]]: The [[Parliament of South Africa|South African Parliament]] repeals the [[Population Registration Act]] which required racial classification of all [[South Africans]] at birth.
*[[1992]] &ndash; A "joint understanding" agreement on arms reduction is signed by U.S. President [[George H. W. Bush|George Bush]] and [[President of Russia|Russian President]] [[Boris Yeltsin]] (this would be later codified in [[START II]]).
*[[1994]] &ndash; Following a televised low-speed highway chase, [[O.J. Simpson]] is arrested for the [[O. J. Simpson murder case|murders]] of his wife, [[Nicole Brown Simpson]], and her friend [[Ronald Goldman]].
